title: Onboarding with Keycard – "Select key storage" screen copy
body:
_Part of #9274 onboarding with Keycard epic (mark as checked there, when closing this issue)_

There are two pieces of copy that might be better: The subtitle and the "About key storage" section. 

**The problems I see in the subtitle:**

* `Your key is stored locally` – Is that correct when it comes to Keycard;
– `There is no copy` – Why should there be? Is that addressing something the user wants to know?;

I suggest this piece of text should address **why this screen exists**, **why is there a choice** and what is the correct choice? Also, we never mention **what is a Keycard** and how to get one.

I suggest something like:
`Your key belongs to you and you get to choose how to store it. Storing it on your device is secure, but it’s even more secure to use a Keycard`

**The problems I see in the "About key storage" section:**
– "Status will never access your private key" we did not mention term "private" before;
– "Be sure to backup your Seed phrase" – We did not offer the seed phrase yet so the user might be confused they missed it;

I suggest this piece of text should explain in more detail **what a key is**, **how is it stored**, mention **security enclaves** and not mention the seed phrase just yet, or say that the user will be offered to save it later.

cc @corpetty @hesterbruikman 

For now, i suggest to come up wit ha better copy and update it.
I suggest also that this screen should be slightly changed in the future iterations to:
